poem:
Title: "The Arctic Jester Speaks"

In the frost-fringed fortress he stands,
Navalny, deriding the Kremlin's bands.
Jokes again from Arctic's edge,
To rattling bars, pledges his pledge.
"Did you sip vodka in goluptious delight?"
Pressed he, sardonic in snowy night.
The irony tastes like frozen steel,
In IK-3, truth does not kneel.
In the hollow heart of the Polar Bear,
Echoes of laughter, echoes of dare.
